artist: Artist: Ōkura Kōtō; Publisher: Kimura Toyokichi
creditline: Gift from the collection of Edith and the late John Payne
description: vertical ōban triptych; triptych forming a single image; group of soldiers rowing a boat in turbulent water; large black rock in top center; beam of light shining on boat from ULC, from a ship in the distance; plumes of white smoke and tiny explosions on left image; dark gray clouds in ULC; inscriptions in Japanese characters, contained in a square with decorative swirling elements in cream and light blue in LLC
inscription: on center sheet, on back, in LLC, in pencil: Roe 03123679
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
title: First Blockade of the Entrance to the Harbor of Port Arthur on the Night of February 24, 1904
